Testimony from Dr: Anthony Fauci: Dr. Fauci, the director of the NIH National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, stated during a congressional hearing that the NIH was told to cancel funding for research on how coronaviruses jump from bats to humans.
Congressional questioning: U.S. Rep. Marc Veasey questioned Dr. Fauci about the cancellation of the grant, expressing confusion as to why research on the coronavirus was halted during a pandemic. This exchange provided further evidence of the claim.
Audio evidence: The exchange between Rep. Veasey and Dr. Fauci can be heard in a C-SPAN video, confirming that Dr. Fauci did indeed state that the NIH was instructed to cancel the grant funding.
Clarification from Dr: Fauci: Dr. Fauci later clarified to Politico that it was the White House specifically that directed the NIH to cut off the funding. This clarification adds credibility to the claim and verifies the authenticity of the statement.
